alert.note: Alert for Lee; Terrell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 7:41PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Lee and northern Terrell Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 741 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Smithville to near Weston. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Smithville, Bronwood, Parrott, Scrutchins, Chokee, Oakville, Chambliss, Olivers Mill, Neyami and Yeomans. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
